title: AP Games Information
description: When requested, the games library will produce the following information about requested games

type.description: A description of the type of involvement this person has with the game

urls.description: List of URLs associated with this person or organization

name.description: The name of the variant. These are looked up from apgames.json by the allvariants() function

uid.description: A short, unique string representing this variant

description.description: A description of the variant. These are looked up from apgames.json by the allvariants() function

group.description: If present, variants of the same `group` are considered mutually exclusive

experimental.description: If present and `true`, the variant will not appear in the production environment.

name.description: The name of the alternative display. These are looked up from apgames.json by the alternativeDisplays() function

uid.description: A short, unique string representing this alternative display

description.description: A description of the alternative display. These are looked up from apgames.json by the alternativeDisplays() function

uid.description: The unique code by which this game is referred to by the system. It's typically lowercase and devoid of whitespace and special characters. It should mirror the game name as much as possible.

description.description: A Markdown-formatted description of the game, which can include a rules summary

notes.description: Markdown-formatted implementation notes. There is where we can explain implementation-specific details about how the game works on Abstract Play specifically. This should help keep the game descriptions clean.

urls.description: List of URLs related to the game

version.description: A string representing the version of the current implementation. The format of the string is irrelevant. Its main purpose is to identify incompatible game state representations. It should be changed whenever the internal game rep changes.

dateAdded.description: The date the game was pushed to production, in ISO year-month-day order.

people.description: The people and organizations involved in the game's creation

playercounts.description: A list of the supported player counts

categories.description: A list categories. The list should not contain any duplicates. Nesting is accomplished by joining the names of levels with the greater-than symbol (>). Names should not contain spaces. Translation into proper labels is left to the client.

flags.description: A list of flags to signal to the front end the presence or absence of a particular feature.
